name: Honey-Garlic Salmon with Stir-Fry Vegetables
author: jennyknickerbocker
summary: My mother-in-law made this honey-garlic salmon for my husband and me and we loved it. One of the best salmon dishes I have had.
ingredients: 1 ¼ pounds skin-on salmon fillet, uncut
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Place honey in a small microwave-safe bowl
Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce, lime juice, and 2 teaspoons garlic; whisk to combine
Place salmon skin-side down on large piece of aluminum foil and fold sides up to hold sauce, keeping top of salmon uncovered
Place the foiled salmon in a baking dish
Spoon 1/2 the honey sauce on top
Bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes
While salmon bakes, heat stir-fry sauce in a medium skillet over medium-high heat
Add remaining garlic; saute until fragrant, about 1 minute
Reduce heat to medium; cook and stir vegetables for 1 more
Add remaining soy sauce; season with salt and pepper
Saute until vegetables are thoroughly heated through and moderately crunchy, 5 to 10 minutes
Spoon some of the remaining honey sauce over salmon and bake for 5 minutes
Adjust oven to broil and broil salmon until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 1 minute more
Cut salmon into 4 pieces; plate and drizzle remaining sauce on top
